sentence.Network_en: A busy night in the restaurant can be frantic in the kitchen.
sentence.Network_cn: 餐馆晚上生意好，厨房里可能会忙成一片。

sentence.Network_en: She watched the frantic flow of cars and buses along the street.
sentence.Network_cn: 她注视着街上小汽车和巴士汇成的滚滚车流。

sentence.Network_en: The vast crowds make Rome a frantic hothouse at times.
sentence.Network_cn: 熙攘的人群有时将罗马变成一个癫狂情绪的爆发地。

list.abs: they point out that emerging economies have been frantically accumulating real assets , as assembly lines and office towers , but their generation of financial assets has not kept pace .他们指出，新兴经济体疯狂的积累真实资产，像是装配线和写字楼，但是他们这一代的金融资产却没有同步跟进。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English frentik, 'insane, violently mad', from Old French frenetique (see frenetic)

entry.tran: (因害怕或担心)发狂的，狂躁的
entry.def: If you are frantic, you are behaving in a wild and uncontrolled way because you are frightened or worried.

example.ex: A bird had been locked in and was by now quite frantic.
example.tran: 一只鸟被关进了笼子，到现在它都十分狂躁。

entry.tran: 匆忙混乱的;紧张忙乱的
entry.def: If an activity is frantic, things are done quickly and in an energetic but disorganized way, because there is very little time.

example.ex: A busy night in the restaurant can be frantic in the kitchen.
example.tran: 餐馆晚上生意好,厨房里可能会忙成一片。

means.word_mean: 1. excessively agitated; transported with rage or other violent emotion;
2. marked by uncontrolled excitement or emotion;

auth_sentence.content: I think I was more frantic than he was.
auth_sentence.res_content: I think I was more frantic than he was.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I think I was more frantic than he was.

auth_sentence.content: He just vanishes into the frantic tangle of limbs.
auth_sentence.res_content: He just vanishes into the frantic tangle of limbs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He just vanishes into the frantic tangle of limbs.

auth_sentence.content: He was frantic and exhausted, all at once.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was frantic and exhausted, all at once.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was frantic and exhausted, all at once.

means.word_mean: 紧张忙乱的;手忙脚乱的

sentences.en: They made frantic attempts to revive him.
sentences.cn: 他们拼命地努力让他苏醒过来。

sentences.en: things in the office are frantic right now.
sentences.cn: 现在办公室里是忙作一团。

means.word_mean: (由于恐惧或担心)无法控制感情的；发狂似的

sentences.en: Let's go back. Your parents must be getting frantic by now.
sentences.cn: 咱们回家吧！你父母现在肯定快要急死了。

sentences.en: The children are driving me frantic.
sentences.cn: 孩子们快要让无发疯了。

jushi.english: He made frantic dash for the departing train.
jushi.chinese: 他发疯似地冲向正开出的火车。

jushi.english: I've had a frantic rush to get my work done.
jushi.chinese: 我急急忙忙地赶完工作。

jushi.english: The mother was frantic when she heard that her child was missing.
jushi.chinese: 母亲听说自己的孩子不见时,急得快要发疯了。
